questions.question: Which of the following positions is not possible for a plane?

answers.a: Plane perpendicular to both HP and VP.
answers.b: Plane parallel to both HP and VP.
answers.c: Plane perpendicular to HP, parallel to VP.
answers.d: Plane perpendicular to VP, parallel to HP

explanations.a: The rigth answer is (b). A plane can be perpendicular to both HP and VP. Example consider PP, it is perpendicular to both HP and VP.
explanations.b: Correct, the rigth answer is (b). A plane cannot be parallel to both HP and VP as both the planes are perpendicular to each other. Either it can parallel to HP or VP but not both.
explanations.c: The rigth answer is (b). Yes, a plane can be perpendicular to HP and parallel to VP.
explanations.d: The rigth answer is (b). Yes, a plane can be perpendicular to VP and parallel to HP.
